        Regional agriculture statistics
          Agri-environmental indicators
          • Soil erosion by water by NUTS 3 regions (source: JRC)

          Structure of agricultural holdings
            Structure of agricultural holdings 2010
              Key farm variables
              • Key farm variables: area, livestock (LSU), labour force and standard output (SO) by agricultural size of farm (UAA), legal status of holding and NUTS 2 regions
              • Key variables: area, livestock (LSU), labour force and standard output (SO) by economic size of farm (SO in Euro), legal status of holding and NUTS 2 regions
              • Key variables: area, livestock (LSU), labour force and standard output (SO) by type of farming (2-digit) and NUTS 2 regions
              Farm land use - Permanent crops, other farmland, irrigation
              • Land use: number of farms and areas of different crops by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Land use: number of farms and areas of different crops by economic size of farm (SO in Euro) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Permanent crops: number of farms and areas by size of permanent crop area and NUTS 2 regions
              • Irrigation: number of farms, areas and equipment by size of irrigated area and NUTS 2 regions
              Overview - Farm livestock
              • Livestock: number of farms and heads of animals of different types by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Livestock: number of farms and heads of animals by livestock units (LSU) of farm and NUTS 2 regions
              • Livestock: number of farms and heads of animals by economic size of farm (SO in Euro) and NUTS 2 regions
              Farm labour force and management
              • Labour force: number of persons and farm work (AWU) by sex of workers and NUTS 2 regions
              • Organic farming: number of farms, areas with different crops and heads of different types of animals by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Type of tenure: number of farms and areas by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Type of tenure: number of farms and areas by economic size of farm (SO in Euro) and NUTS 2 regions
              Survey on agricultural production methods (SAPM, 2010)
              • Tillage methods: number of farms and areas by size of arable area and NUTS 2 regions
              • Tillage methods: number of farms and areas by economic size of farm (SO in euros) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Soil conservation: number of farms and areas by size of arable area and NUTS 2 regions
              • Soil conservation: number of farms and areas by economic size of farm (SO in euros) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Landscape features: number of farms and areas by agricultural size (UAA), economic size of farm (SO in euros) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Animal grazing on the holding: number of farms and area grazed by duration, economic size of farm (SO in euros) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Animal housing - cattle: number of farms and places by cattle size classes, economic size of farm (SO in euros) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Animal housing - cattle: number of farms and places by cattle size class, agricultural size of farm (UAA) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Animal housing - pigs: number of farms and places by pig size classes, economic size of farm (SO in euros) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Animal housing - laying hens: number of farms and places by laying hens size classes, economic size of farm (SO in euros) and NUTS 2 regions
              • Manure exported from the holding in % of total produced: number of farms and areas by economic size (SO in euros), agriculture size (UAA) of farm and NUTS 2 regions
              • Manure exported from the holding in % of total produced: number of farms and areas by economic size (SO in euros), livestock units (LSU) of farm and NUTS 2 regions
              • Manure storage and treatment facilities: number of farms and areas by economic size (SO in euros), agriculture size (UAA) of farm and NUTS 2 regions
              • Manure storage and treatment facilities: number of farms and areas by economic size (SO in euros), livestock units (LSU) of farm and NUTS 2 regions

          • Long-term residents by age, sex and citizenship on 31 December of each year

          • EU Blue Cards holders and family members by Member State of previous residence

            • Accidents at work by type of injury and severity (NACE Rev. 2, A, C-N)

            • Relative incidence rate of accidental injuries at work by working hours, number of job contract, economic activity of the employer, age and sex (EU mean rate = 100)
            • Relative incidence rate of accidental injuries at work by occupation and economic activity of the employer (EU mean rate = 100)

            • Relative incidence rate of accidental injuries at work by severity, frequency of shift work and age (EU mean rate = 100 for each severity)
            • Relative incidence rate of accidental injuries at work by severity, working hours and sex (EU mean rate = 100 for each severity)

            • Average time between leaving formal education and starting the first job by age, sex and educational attainment level for persons who left within the last 3 or 5 years - (months)
            • Employment rates by age, sex, educational attainment level and number of years after leaving formal education

            • Young people's social origin, educational attainment level and labour outcomes in Europe
            • Parents educational attainment level
            • Job mismatches and their labour market effects among school-leavers in Europe

      Labour market
        Employment and unemployment (Labour Force Survey)
          LFS main indicators
            Employment and activity - LFS adjusted series
            • Employment and activity by sex and age - annual data
            • Employment and activity by sex and age - quarterly data
            • Employment by educational attainment level - annual data
            • Employment by educational attainment level - quarterly data
            • Part-time employment and temporary contracts - annual data
            • Part-time employment and temporary contracts - quarterly data
            • Employment growth and activity branches - annual averages
            • Employment growth and activity branches - quarterly data
            • Duration of working life - annual data
            • Average exit age from the labour force - annual data
            Unemployment - LFS adjusted series
            • Unemployment by sex and age - annual average
            • Unemployment by sex and age - quarterly average
            • Unemployment by sex and age - monthly average
            • Long-term unemployment by sex - annual average
            • Long-term unemployment by sex - quarterly average
            • Supplementary indicators to unemployment - annual data
            • Supplementary indicators to unemployment - quarterly data
            • Population in jobless households - annual data
            Labour market transitions - LFS longitudinal data
            • Labour market transitions - quarterly data
          LFS series - detailed quarterly survey results (from 1998 onwards)
            Population - LFS series
            • Population by sex, age, citizenship and labour status (1 000)
            • Population by sex, age and educational attainment level (1 000)
            • Population by sex, age and participation in education and training (last 4 weeks) (1 000)

            • Average number of actual weekly hours of work in the second job, by sex, professional status, economic activity and full-time/part-time in the first job (1998-2008, NACE Rev. 1.1) - hours

            • Unemployment rates by sex, age and educational attainment level (%)
            • Unemployment by sex, age and citizenship (1 000)
            • Unemployment by sex, age and duration of unemployment (1 000)
            • Unemployed by sex, age and type of employment sought (1 000)
            • Previous occupations of the unemployed, by sex (1 000)

            • Long-term unemployment (12 months or more) as a percentage of the total unemployment, by sex and age (%)
            • Supplementary indicators to unemployment by sex and age
            • Supplementary indicators to unemployment by sex and educational attainment level

            • Inactive population by sex, age and educational attainment level (1 000)
            • Inactive population by sex, age and willingness to work (1 000)

            2006. Transition from work into retirement

            • Number of employed persons who would stay longer at work (or not) if more flexible working time arrangements were available - by sex and occupation (1 000)
            • Number of employed persons who would stay longer at work (or not) if they could update their skills - by sex and occupation (1 000)
            • Number of employed persons who would stay longer at work (or not) if their workplace was healthier and/or safer - by sex and occupation (1 000)

            • Employed persons, average number of years spent working of employed persons - by sex and occupation
            • Average number of years spent working - by sex and main financial incentive to stay at work
            • Number of not employed persons having reduced their working hours in a move to full retirement - by sex and age (1 000)
            • Main reasons for retirement or early retirement - by sex and main labour status just after leaving last job (1 000)
            • Number of not employed persons who would have stayed longer at work (or not) if more flexible working time arrangements had been available - by sex and occupation (previous job) (1 000)
            • Number of not employed persons who would have stayed longer at work (or not) if they had had more opportunities to update their skills - by sex and occupation (previous job) (1 000)
            • Number of not employed persons who would have stayed longer at work (or not) if their workplace had been healthier and/or safer - by sex and occupation (previous job) (1 000)
            • Average age at which not employed persons started receiving a retirement pension - by sex and main labour status just after leaving last job
            • Average age at which not employed persons started receiving a retirement pension - by sex and main reason for retirement or early retirement
            • Average age at which not employed persons started receiving a retirement pension - by granting of other individual benefits and sex
            • Not employed persons, average number of years spent working, by sex and economic activity (previous job, NACE Rev. 1.1)
            • Not employed persons, average number of years spent working - by sex and occupation (previous job)
            • Not employed persons, average number of years spent working - by granting of other individual benefits and sex

            • Main reasons (linked with care of other people in need of care) given by employed persons between 15 and 64 years old for not working or not working more, by occupation

            • Number of employed persons between 15 and 64 years old who can take whole days off for family reasons, by economic activity

        • Time spent in total work (paid and unpaid work as main or secondary activity) by sex and by form of work - collection round 2000

    Agriculture, forestry and fisheries
      Agriculture
        Farm structure
          Farm structure - 2008 legislation (from 2005 onwards)
            Key farm variables
            • Key farm variables: area, livestock (LSU), labour force and standard output (SO) by agricultural size of farm (UAA), legal status of holding and NUTS 2 regions
            • Key variables: area, livestock (LSU), labour force and standard output (SO) by economic size of farm (SO in Euro), legal status of holding and NUTS 2 regions
            • Key variables: area, livestock (LSU), labour force and standard output (SO) by type of farming (2-digit) and agricultural size of farm (UAA)
            • Key farm variables: area, livestock (LSU), labour force and standard output (SO) by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and age of manager
            • Key variables: area, livestock (LSU), labour force and standard output (SO) by type of farming (2-digit) and economic size of farm (SO in Euro)
            • Key variables: area, livestock (LSU), labour force and standard output (SO) by type of farming (2-digit) and NUTS 2 regions
            Overview - Farm land use
            • Land use: number of farms and areas of different crops by type of farming (2-digit)
            • Land use: number of farms and areas of different crops by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and NUTS 2 regions
            • Land use: number of farms and areas of different crops by economic size of farm (SO in Euro) and NUTS 2 regions
            Overview - Farm livestock
            • Livestock: number of farms and heads of animals by type of farming (2-digit)
            • Livestock: number of farms and heads of animals of different types by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and NUTS 2 regions
            • Livestock: number of farms and heads of animals by livestock units (LSU) of farm and NUTS 2 regions
            • Livestock: number of farms and heads of animals by economic size of farm (SO in Euro) and NUTS 2 regions
            Overview - Farm labour force
            • Labour force: number of persons and farm work (AWU) by type of farming (2-digit) and economic size of farm (SO in Euro)
            • Labour force: number of persons and farm work (AWU) by agricultural size of farm (UAA)
            • Labour force: number of persons and farm work (AWU) by sex of workers and NUTS 2 regions
            Farm land use - Arable land
            • Arable crops: number of farms and areas of different arable crops by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and size of arable area
            • Arable crops: number of farms and areas of different arable crops by economic size of farm (SO in Euro) and size of arable area
            • Cereals: number of farms and areas by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and size of cereal area
            • Common wheat: number of farms and areas by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and size of common wheat area
            • Barley: number of farms and areas by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and size of barley area
            • Grain maize: number of farms and areas by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and size of grain maize area
            • Potatoes: number of farms and area by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and size of potato area
            • Industrial crops: number of farms and areas by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and size of industrial crop area
            • Sugar beet: number of farms and areas by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and size of sugar beet area
            • Vegetables, melons, strawberries: number of farms and areas by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and size of vegetable, melon and strawberry outdoor area
            • Flowers and ornamental plants: number of farms and areas by agricultural size of farm (UAA)
            Farm land use - Permanent crops, other farmland, irrigation
            • Permanent crops: number of farms and areas by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and size of permanent crop area
            • Permanent crops: number of farms and areas by economic size of farm (SO in Euro) and size of permanent crop area
            • Permanent crops: number of farms and areas by size of permanent crop area and NUTS 2 regions

            • Other land: number of farms and areas by agricultural size of farm (UAA)
            • Mushrooms, energy crops, GMO: number of farms and areas by size of farm (UAA)

            • Support for rural development: number of farms, agricultural area, standard output (SO) and livestock (LSU) by age and sex of holder

            • Holder-manager relationship: area, livestock, labour force and standard output (SO) by agricultural size of farm (UAA)
            • Farm equipment: agricultural area and number of farms with different type of equipment by agricultural size of farm (UAA)
            • Farm machinery: number of farms and machines by size of farm (UAA)
            • Organic farming: number of farms, areas with different crops and heads of different types of animals by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and NUTS 2 regions
            • Type of tenure: number of farms and areas by agricultural size of farm (UAA) and NUTS 2 regions
            • Type of tenure: number of farms and areas by economic size of farm (SO in Euro) and NUTS 2 regions

            • Common land grazing: number of farms and grazing livestock (LSU) by duration and economic size of farm (SO in euros)
            • Animal housing - cattle: number of farms and places by cattle size class, agricultural size of farm (UAA) and NUTS 2 regions
            • Animal housing - cattle: number of farms and places by cattle size classes, economic size of farm (SO in euros) and NUTS 2 regions

            • Animal housing - laying hens: number of farms and places by laying hens size classes, economic size of farm (SO in euros) and NUTS 2 regions
            • Solid manure application as % of the UAA: number of holdings and UAA by economic size (SO in euros) and agriculture size (UAA) of farm
            • Solid manure application as % of the UAA: number of holdings and areas by economic size (SO in euros) and livestock units (LSU) of farm
            • Slurry application as % of the UAA: number of holdings and areas by economic size (SO in euros) and agriculture size (UAA) of farm
            • Slurry application as % of the UAA: number of holdings and areas by economic size (SO in euros) and livestock units (LSU) of farm

            • Manure exported from the holding in % of total produced: number of farms and areas by economic size (SO in euros), livestock units (LSU) of farm and NUTS 2 regions

            • Manure storage and treatment facilities: number of farms and areas by economic size (SO in euros), livestock units (LSU) of farm and NUTS 2 regions

            • Individuals using the internet for listening to webradio/watching web television
            • Individuals using the internet for internet banking
            • Individuals using the internet for selling goods or services
            • Individuals using the internet to buy or order online content
            • Individuals using the internet for playing or downloading games, images, films or music
            • Individuals using the internet for looking for a job or sending a job application
            • Individuals using the internet for consulting wiki
            • Individuals using the internet for doing an online course
            • Individuals using the internet for taking part in online consultations or voting
            • Individuals using the internet for looking for information about education, training or course offers
            • Individuals who have carried out 1 or 2 of the computer related activities
            • Individuals who have carried out 3 or 4 of the computer related activities
            • Individuals who have carried out 5 or 6 of the computer related activities
            • Individuals who have carried out 1 or 2 of the internet related activities
            • Individuals who have carried out 3 or 4 of the related internet activities
            • Individuals who have carried out 5 or 6 of the related internet activities
            D. ICT usage by enterprises
            • Share of enterprises' turnover on e-commerce - %
            • Enterprises sharing electronically information on sales or on purchases with the software used for any internal function
            • Enterprises using automated data exchange with customers or suppliers
            • Enterprises sending and/or receiving e-invoices
            • Enterprises using radio frequency identification (RFID) instrument
            • Enterprises whose business processes are automatically linked to those of their suppliers and/or customers
            • Enterprises using software solutions, like CRM to analyse information about clients for marketing purposes
            E. E-public services
            • Individuals using the internet for interaction with public authorities
            • Enterprises using the internet for interaction with public authorities
            • Enterprises using the internet for interaction with public authorities, by interaction
            • Enterprises using the internet for submitting a proposal in a public electronic tender system to public authorities
          Benchmarking indicator: public services - e-Government
          • E-government usage by individuals

        • Number of mobile phone subscriptions (1 000)
        • Mobile phone subscriptions

Cross cutting topics
    Quality of life
      Material living conditions
        Income
        • Mean and median income by age and sex - EU-SILC survey
        • At-risk-of-poverty rate by poverty threshold, age and sex - EU-SILC survey
        • At-risk-of-poverty rate anchored at a fixed moment in time (2008) by age and sex - EU-SILC survey
        • S80/S20 income quintile share ratio by sex and selected age group - EU-SILC survey
        Material
        • Severely materially deprived people
        • Inability to make ends meet - EU-SILC survey
        • Share of total population living in a dwelling with a leaking roof, damp walls, floors or foundation, or rot in window frames of floor - EU-SILC survey
        • Share of total population having neither a bath, nor a shower, nor indoor flushing toilet in their household - EU-SILC survey
      Productive or main activity
        Quantity of employment
        • Unemployment rates by sex, age and educational attainment level (%)
        • Long-term unemployment (12 months or more) as a percentage of the total unemployment, by sex and age (%)
        • People living in households with very low work intensity by age and sex (population aged 0 to 59 years)
        • People living in households with very low work intensity by income quintile and household type (population aged 0 to 59 years)
        • Involuntary part-time employment as percentage of the total part-time employment, by sex and age (%)
        Quality of employment
        • Low-wage earners as a proportion of all employees (excluding apprentices) by age
        • Low-wage earners as a proportion of all employees (excluding apprentices) by sex
        • Low-wage earners as a proportion of all employees (excluding apprentices) by educational attainment level
        • Persons reporting an accident at work by sex, age and educational attainment level
        • Persons reporting a work-related health problem by sex, age and educational attainment level
        • Persons reporting exposure to risk factors that can adversely affect physical health by sex, age and educational attainment level
        • Persons reporting exposure to risk factors that can adversely affect mental well-being by sex, age and educational attainment level
        • Accidents at work by sex and age (NACE Rev. 2, A, C-N)
        • Average number of usual weekly hours of work in main job, by sex, professional status, full-time/part-time and economic activity (from 2008 onwards, NACE Rev. 2) - hours
        • Employees working shifts as a percentage of the total of employees, by sex and age (%)
        • Employed persons working on Saturdays as a percentage of the total employment, by sex, age and professional status (%)
        • Employed persons working on Sundays as a percentage of the total employment, by sex, age and professional status (%)
        • Employed persons working in the evenings as a percentage of the total employment, by sex, age and professional status (%)
        • Employed persons working at nights as a percentage of the total employment, by sex, age and professional status (%)
      Health
        Outcomes

        • People having a long-standing illness or health problem, by sex, age and educational attainment level

        • Self-perceived long-standing limitations in usual activities due to health problem by sex, age and educational attainment level
        • Self-perceived long-standing limitations in usual activities due to health problem by sex, age and income quintile
        • Psychological distress by sex, age and educational attainment level (average score)
        Drivers - healthy and unhealthy behaviors
        • Body mass index (BMI) by sex, age and educational attainment level (%)
        • Body mass index (BMI) by sex, age and income quintile (%)
        • Daily smokers of cigarettes by sex, age and educational attainment level (%)
        • Daily smokers of cigarettes by sex, age and income quintile (%)
        Access to health care
        • Self-reported unmet needs for medical examination by sex, age, detailed reason and income quintile
        • Self-reported unmet needs for medical examination by sex, age, detailed reason and educational attainment level
      Education
        Competences and skills
        • Population by educational attainment level, sex and age (%) - main indicators
        Lifelong learning
        • Participation rate in education and training (last 4 weeks) by sex and labour status

        • Crime, violence or vandalism in the area - EU-SILC survey

        • Urban population exposure to air pollution by particulate matter
